item.title: Hubblecast 32: Born in Beauty: Proplyds in the Orion Nebula
item.itunes:author: ESA/Hubble
item.description: Visible to the naked eye, only 1500 light-years from Earth, the great Orion Nebula has been known and revered since ancient times. A popular target of Hubble, researchers have now identified 42 new discs within it that could be the beginnings of new planetary systems like our own.
item.itunes:subtitle: Visible to the naked eye, only 1500 light-years from Earth, the great Orion Nebula has been known and revered since ancient times. A popular target of Hubble, researchers have now identified 42 new discs within it that could be the beginnings of new planetary systems like our own.
item.itunes:summary: Visible to the naked eye, only 1500 light-years from Earth, the great Orion Nebula has been known and revered since ancient times. A popular target of Hubble, researchers have now identified 42 new discs within it that could be the beginnings of new planetary systems like our own.

item.title: Hubblecast 26: Exceptionally deep view of strange galaxy
item.itunes:author: ESA/Hubble
item.description: A spectacular new Hubble image of an unusual spiral galaxy in the Coma Galaxy Cluster has been released. It reveals lots of new details of the galaxy, NGC 4921, as well as an extraordinary rich background of more remote galaxies stretching back to the early Universe.
item.itunes:subtitle: A spectacular new Hubble image of an unusual spiral galaxy in the Coma Galaxy Cluster has been released. It reveals lots of new details of the galaxy, NGC 4921, as well as an extraordinary rich background of more remote galaxies stretching back to the early Universe.

item.title: Hubblecast 22: Hubble directly observes planet orbiting Fomalhaut
item.itunes:author: ESA/Hubble
item.description: The NASA/ESA Hubble Space Telescope has discovered an extrasolar planet using direct visible-light imaging for the first time. The strange world is far-flung from its parent star, is surrounded by a colossal belt of gas and dust, and may even have rings more impressive than Saturn's.
item.itunes:subtitle: The NASA/ESA Hubble Space Telescope has discovered an extrasolar planet using direct visible-light imaging for the first time. The strange world is far-flung from its parent star, is surrounded by a colossal belt of gas and dust, and may even have rings more impressive than Saturn's.
item.itunes:summary: The NASA/ESA Hubble Space Telescope has discovered an extrasolar planet using direct visible-light imaging for the first time. The strange world is far-flung from its parent star, is surrounded by a colossal belt of gas and dust, and may even have rings more impressive than Saturn's.
item.itunes:keywords: Hubble Space Telescope, podcasts, astronomy, podcasts, HD, high definition, observatory, stars, planets, sky, cosmos, astronomy, videos, exoplanet, Fomalhaut, extrasolar

item.title: Hubblecast 18: Hubble sees magnetic monster in erupting galaxy
item.itunes:author: ESA/Hubble
item.description: The Hubble Space Telescope has solved a long-standing puzzle by resolving giant but delicate filaments shaped by a strong magnetic field around the active galaxy NGC 1275. It is the most striking example so far of the influence of the immense tentacles of extragalactic magnetic fields.
item.itunes:subtitle: The Hubble Space Telescope has solved a long-standing puzzle by resolving giant but delicate filaments shaped by a strong magnetic field around the active galaxy NGC 1275. It is the most striking example so far of the influence of the immense tentacles of extragalactic magnetic fields.

item.title: Hubblecast 16: Galaxies gone wild!
item.itunes:author: ESA/Hubble
item.description: One of the big mysteries in astronomy is how galaxies grow and evolve over time. Collisions between galaxies are thought to be key events that shape their development. A stunning collection of 59 new images of colliding galaxies has been released to mark the 18th anniversary of the NASA/ESA Hubble Space Telescope. They give us a unique insight into how galaxies collide to form larger galaxies.
item.itunes:subtitle: One of the big mysteries in astronomy is how galaxies grow and evolve over time. Collisions between galaxies are thought to be key events that shape their development. A stunning collection of 59 new images of colliding galaxies has been released to mark the 18th anniversary of the NASA/ESA Hubble Space Telescope. They give us a unique insight into how galaxies collide to form larger galaxies.
item.itunes:summary: One of the big mysteries in astronomy is how galaxies grow and evolve over time. Collisions between galaxies are thought to be key events that shape their development. A stunning collection of 59 new images of colliding galaxies has been released to mark the 18th anniversary of the NASA/ESA Hubble Space Telescope. They give us a unique insight into how galaxies collide to form larger galaxies.
item.itunes:keywords: HD, High Definition, galaxies, merging galaxies, Hubble Space Telescope, Full HD, Full High Definition, astronomy, sky, astrophysics, astrophotos, HST, space telescope, astronomy, ESA, vodcast

item.title: Hubblecast 15: Black hole found in enigmatic Omega Centauri
item.itunes:author: ESA/Hubble
item.description: For astronomers, Omega Centauri has been an outcast amongst globular clusters for a long time. A new result obtained by the NASA/ESA Hubble Space Telescope and the Gemini Observatory provides a surprising explanation for Omega Centauri's peculiarities.
item.itunes:subtitle: For astronomers, Omega Centauri has been an outcast amongst globular clusters for a long time. A new result obtained by the NASA/ESA Hubble Space Telescope and the Gemini Observatory provides a surprising explanation for Omega Centauri's peculiarities.
item.itunes:summary: For astronomers, Omega Centauri has been an outcast amongst globular clusters for a long time. A new result obtained by the NASA/ESA Hubble Space Telescope and the Gemini Observatory provides a surprising explanation for Omega Centauri's peculiarities.
item.itunes:keywords: HD, High Definition, exoplanet, extrasolar planet, planets, planetary system, Hubble Space Telescope, Full HD, Full High Definition, astronomy, sky, astrophysics, astrophotos, HST, space telescope, astronomy, ESA, vodcast

item.title: Hubblecast 14: Hubble finds first organic molecule on extrasolar planet
item.itunes:author: ESA/Hubble
item.description: The NASA/ESA Hubble Space Telescope has made the first detection ever of an organic molecule in a planet orbiting another star. This breakthrough is an important step in eventually identifying signs of life on a planet outside our Solar System.
item.itunes:subtitle: The NASA/ESA Hubble Space Telescope has made the first detection ever of an organic molecule in a planet orbiting another star. This breakthrough is an important step in eventually identifying signs of life on a planet outside our Solar System.
item.itunes:summary: The NASA/ESA Hubble Space Telescope has made the first detection ever of an organic molecule in a planet orbiting another star. This breakthrough is an important step in eventually identifying signs of life on a planet outside our Solar System.
item.itunes:keywords: HD, High Definition, exoplanet, extrasolar planet, planets, planetary system, Hubble Space Telescope, Full HD, Full High Definition, astronomy, sky, astrophysics, astrophotos, HST, space telescope, astronomy, ESA, vodcast

item.title: Hubblecast 13: Gargantuan galaxy NGC 1132 - A cosmic fossil
item.itunes:author: ESA/Hubble
item.description: The NASA/ESA Hubble Space Telescope has captured a new image of the galaxy NGC 1132, which is most likely to be a cosmic fossil - the aftermath of an enormous multi-galactic pile-up, where the carnage of collision after collision has built up a brilliant but fuzzy giant elliptical galaxy far outshining typical galaxies.
item.itunes:subtitle: The NASA/ESA Hubble Space Telescope has captured a new image of the galaxy NGC 1132, which is most likely to be a cosmic fossil - the aftermath of an enormous multi-galactic pile-up, where the carnage of collision after collision has built up a brilliant but fuzzy giant elliptical galaxy far outshining typical galaxies.
item.itunes:summary: The NASA/ESA Hubble Space Telescope has captured a new image of the galaxy NGC 1132, which is most likely to be a cosmic fossil - the aftermath of an enormous multi-galactic pile-up, where the carnage of collision after collision has built up a brilliant but fuzzy giant elliptical galaxy far outshining typical galaxies.
item.itunes:keywords: HD, High Definition, galaxies, clusters, NGC 1132, elliptical galaxy, Hubble Space Telescope, Full HD, Full High Definition, astronomy, sky, astrophysics, astrophotos, HST, space telescope, astronomy, ESA, vodcast

item.title: Hubblecast 12: Murk on a monster planet
item.itunes:author: ESA/Hubble
item.description: Using the NASA/ESA Hubble Space Telescope, astronomers have found the first clear evidence of high altitude haze or clouds in the atmosphere of an extrasolar planet. This discovery reveals a deeper understanding of the class of giant planets that astronomers call hot Jupiters.
item.itunes:subtitle: Using the NASA/ESA Hubble Space Telescope, astronomers have found the first clear evidence of high altitude haze or clouds in the atmosphere of an extrasolar planet. This discovery reveals a deeper understanding of the class of giant planets that astronomers call hot Jupiters.
item.itunes:summary: Using the NASA/ESA Hubble Space Telescope, astronomers have found the first clear evidence of high altitude haze or clouds in the atmosphere of an extrasolar planet. This discovery reveals a deeper understanding of the class of giant planets that astronomers call hot Jupiters.
item.itunes:keywords: HD, Hubblecast, High Definition, stars, clusters, NGC 3603, nebula, Hubble Space Telescope, Full HD, Full High Definition, astronomy, sky, astrophysics, astrophotos, HST, space telescope, astronomy, ESA, vodcast

item.title: Hubblecast 11: A grand design in a galactic festoon
item.itunes:author: ESA/Hubble
item.description: The galaxy Messier 74 lies at a distance of over 30 million light years. In this latest image from the NASA/ESA Hubble Space Telescope the enormous swirls of this stunning spiral galaxy arc across space, adorned with glowing pink regions of hydrogen gas and lit by the pale blue light of millions of newly formed stars.
item.itunes:subtitle: The galaxy Messier 74 lies at a distance of over 30 million light years. In this latest image from the NASA/ESA Hubble Space Telescope the enormous swirls of this stunning spiral galaxy arc across space, adorned with glowing pink regions of hydrogen gas and lit by the pale blue light of millions of newly formed stars.

item.title: Hubblecast 10: Making the Universe come to life - behind the Hubble images
item.itunes:author: ESA/Hubble
item.description: We live in a Universe of unimaginable scale and almost incomprehensible beauty. How is the light from the Universe transformed into the images that have inspired generations by making the Universe come to life?
item.itunes:subtitle: We live in a Universe of unimaginable scale and almost incomprehensible beauty. How is the light from the Universe transformed into the images that have inspired generations by making the Universe come to life?

item.itunes:keywords: Hubble Space Telescope, CCD, RGB, astrophoto, vodcasts, astronomy, podcasts, HD, high definition, observatory, stars, planets, sky, cosmos, astronomy, videos

item.title: Hubblecast 09: Extreme star cluster bursts into life!
item.itunes:author: ESA/Hubble
item.description: The NASA/ESA Hubble Space Telescope has captured a spectacular image of NGC 3603, a giant nebula hosting one of the most prominent massive young clusters in the Milky Way. This is a splendid location for continued studies of stellar birth in star forming regions.
item.itunes:subtitle: The NASA/ESA Hubble Space Telescope has captured a spectacular image of NGC 3603, a giant nebula hosting one of the most prominent massive young clusters in the Milky Way. This is a splendid location for continued studies of stellar birth in star forming regions.

item.itunes:keywords: HD, High Definition, stars, clusters, NGC 3603, nebula, Hubble Space Telescope, Full HD, Full High Definition, astronomy, sky, astrophysics, astrophotos, HST, space telescope, astronomy, ESA, vodcast

item.title: Hubblecast 08: A step closer to our origin
item.itunes:author: ESA/Hubble
item.description: By scrutinising the Hubble Ultra Deep field - the deepest image of the sky ever made - the NASA/ESA Hubble Space Telescope and the NASA Spitzer Space Telescope have joined forces to discover nine of the smallest, faintest, most compact galaxies ever observed in the distant Universe.
item.itunes:subtitle: By scrutinising the Hubble Ultra Deep field - the deepest image of the sky ever made - the NASA/ESA Hubble Space Telescope and the NASA Spitzer Space Telescope have joined forces to discover nine of the smallest, faintest, most compact galaxies ever observed in the distant Universe.
item.itunes:summary: By scrutinising the Hubble Ultra Deep field - the deepest image of the sky ever made - the NASA/ESA Hubble Space Telescope and the NASA Spitzer Space Telescope have joined forces to discover nine of the smallest, faintest, most compact galaxies ever observed in the distant Universe.
item.itunes:keywords: HD, High Definition, Hubble Space Telescope, Full HD, Full High Definition, ultra deep field, cosmology, galaxies, universe, big bang, galaxy, UDF, HUDF, astronomy, sky, astrophysics, astrophotos, HST, space telescope, astronomy, ESA, vodcast

item.title: Hubblecast 07: Uncovering the Veil Nebula
item.itunes:author: ESA/Hubble
item.description: The NASA/ESA Hubble Space Telescope has uncovered magnificent sections of the Veil Nebula - the shattered remains of a supernova that exploded some 5-10,000 years ago. The new Hubble images provide beautiful views of the delicate, wispy structure resulting from this cosmic explosion.
item.itunes:subtitle: The NASA/ESA Hubble Space Telescope has uncovered magnificent sections of the Veil Nebula - the shattered remains of a supernova that exploded some 5-10,000 years ago. The new Hubble images provide beautiful views of the delicate, wispy structure resulting from this cosmic explosion.
item.itunes:summary: The NASA/ESA Hubble Space Telescope has uncovered magnificent sections of the Veil Nebula - the shattered remains of a supernova that exploded some 5-10,000 years ago. The new Hubble images provide beautiful views of the delicate, wispy structure resulting from this cosmic explosion.
item.itunes:keywords: HD, High Definition, Hubble Space Telescope, Full HD, Full High Definition, Veil Nebula, Cygnus Loop, Cygni, supernovae, supernova, SNR, astronomy, sky, astrophysics, astrophotos, HST, space telescope, astronomy, ESA, vodcast

item.title: Hubblecast 06: A battle of giants - telescopes in space and on the ground
item.itunes:author: ESA/Hubble
item.description: Have you ever wondered why some telescopes are launched into space while others are built on remote mountain tops? What is actually the best for astronomy? Here we provide a ringside view of the fight for the elusive photons from deep space - is it a battle of the telescope giants?
item.itunes:subtitle: Have you ever wondered why some telescopes are launched into space while others are built on remote mountain tops? What is actually the best for astronomy? Here we provide a ringside view of the fight for the elusive photons from deep space - is it a battle of the telescope giants?
item.itunes:summary: Have you ever wondered why some telescopes are launched into space while others are built on remote mountain tops? What is actually the best for astronomy? Here we provide a ringside view of the fight for the elusive photons from deep space - is it a battle of the telescope giants?
item.itunes:keywords: Hubble Space Telescope, vodcasts, astronomy, podcasts, HD, high definition, ESO, VLT, Keck, observatories, observatory, Subaru, stars, planets, sky, cosmos, astronomy videos

item.title: Hubblecast 05: Hubble discovers ring of dark matter
item.itunes:author: ESA/Hubble
item.description: An international team of astronomers using the NASA/ESA Hubble Space Telescope has discovered a ghostly ring of dark matter formed long ago during a colossal collision between two galaxy clusters. This is the first time that dark matter has been found with a distribution that differs substantially from the distribution of ordinary matter.
item.itunes:subtitle: An international team of astronomers using the NASA/ESA Hubble Space Telescope has discovered a ghostly ring of dark matter formed long ago during a colossal collision between two galaxy clusters. This is the first time that dark matter has been found with a distribution that differs substantially from the distribution of ordinary matter.
item.itunes:summary: An international team of astronomers using the NASA/ESA Hubble Space Telescope has discovered a ghostly ring of dark matter formed long ago during a colossal collision between two galaxy clusters. This is the first time that dark matter has been found with a distribution that differs substantially from the distribution of ordinary matter.
item.itunes:keywords: Hubble Space Telescope, vodcast, cosmology, dark matter, galaxies, astronomy,space science, galaxy cluster, video podcast, high resolution, videos, pictures

item.title: Hubblecast 04: Hubble Finds Multiple Stellar 'Baby Booms' in a Globular Cluster
item.itunes:author: ESA/Hubble
item.description: New Hubble observations of the massive globular cluster NGC 2808 provide evidence that it has three generations of stars instead of one as current theories predict.
item.itunes:subtitle: New Hubble observations of the massive globular cluster NGC 2808 provide evidence that it has three generations of stars instead of one as current theories predict.
item.itunes:summary: New Hubble observations of the massive globular cluster NGC 2808 provide evidence that it has three generations of stars instead of one as current theories predict.
item.itunes:keywords: Hubble Space Telescope, vodcast, cosmology, galaxies, astronomy,space science, galaxy cluster, video podcast, high resolution, videos, pictures

item.title: Hubblecast 03: Celebrating Hubble's 17th birthday with violent stellar fireworks
item.itunes:author: ESA/Hubble
item.description: The NASA/ESA Hubble Space Telescope celebrates its 17th birthday with one of the largest panoramic images ever taken. The violent stellar fireworks of the Carina Nebula.
item.itunes:subtitle: The NASA/ESA Hubble Space Telescope celebrates its 17th birthday with one of the largest panoramic images ever taken. The violent stellar fireworks of the Carina Nebula.
item.itunes:summary: The NASA/ESA Hubble Space Telescope celebrates its 17th birthday with one of the largest panoramic images ever taken. The violent stellar fireworks of the Carina Nebula.
item.itunes:keywords: Hubble Space Telescope, vodcast, astronomy,space science, video podcast, high resolution, videos, pictures, nebula, stars, carina, nebulae

item.title: Hubblecast 02: Galaxy bars and supermassive black holes
item.itunes:author: ESA/Hubble
item.description: Hubble has delivered an unrivalled snapshot of the nearby barred spiral galaxy NGC 1672. This remarkable image provides a high-definition view of the galaxy's large bar, its fields of star-forming clouds and its dark bands of interstellar dust.
item.itunes:subtitle: Hubble has delivered an unrivalled snapshot of the nearby barred spiral galaxy NGC 1672. This remarkable image provides a high-definition view of the galaxy's large bar, its fields of star-forming clouds and its dark bands of interstellar dust.
item.itunes:summary: Hubble has delivered an unrivalled snapshot of the nearby barred spiral galaxy NGC 1672. This remarkable image provides a high-definition view of the galaxy's large bar, its fields of star-forming clouds and its dark bands of interstellar dust.
item.itunes:keywords: Hubble Space Telescope, vodcast, cosmology, galaxies, astronomy,space science, galaxy cluster, video podcast, high resolution, videos, pictures

item.title: Hubblecast 01: Hubble sees 'Comet Galaxy' being ripped apart by galaxy cluster
item.itunes:author: ESA/Hubble
item.description: The NASA/ESA Hubble Space Telescope, in collaboration with several other ground- and space-based telescopes, has captured a galaxy being ripped apart by a galaxy cluster's gravitational field and harsh environment. The finding sheds light on the mysterious process by which gas-rich spiral-shaped galaxies might evolve into gas-poor irregular- or elliptical-shaped galaxies over billions of years.
